article_title: Malloy Meets Obama, Biden At White House
article_text:
Gov. Dannel P. Malloy met with President Barack Obama and Vice President Joe Biden during a roundtable discussion involving more than a dozen other governors as part of the National Governors Association's winter meeting.

Here's the White House pool report from the gathering:

The president spoke for about 4 minutes, praising the governors for their efforts at raising minimum wages and expanding early childhood education, and enacting measures such as paid sick leave in Vermont. He said the success of the Affordable Care Act is "thanks to the efforts of all of you."

(Connecticut was a leader in several of these efforts, including being the first state in the country to raise the minimum wage to $10.10 an hour. Obama visited Central Connecticut State University in New Britain in 2014 to talk about that issue. And Access Health CT, the state's health insurance exchange under the Affordable Care Act, has been touted as a model for other states to follow.)

"There's one thing in particular I'm going to make a focus this year, and that's protecting everybody's right to vote. The job of our democracy is to make it easier, not harder, for our citizens to vote."

(Courtesy of Governor Malloy's Office) (Courtesy of Governor Malloy's Office)

Praised efforts in California and Oregon to adopt automatic voter registration.

"It's about making democracy as good as it can be."

The president praised Gov. Hickenlooper of Colorado for having "a very good year."

"First he gets married, then the Broncos win the Super Bowl," he said.

Mr. Obama was flanked by Mr. Biden and Valerie Jarrett. Also at the table were Cecilia Munoz, David Simas and Labor Secretary Tom Perez.
